page.title: 06Black Dyke Mills Brass Band
page.content: A brass and read band, originally formed in 1815, became associated with Black Dyke Mills when John Foster, a french horn player who owned the mills gave financial support. Since 1855 the band has been sponsored by Black Dyke Mills. At first all the band members worked at John Foster's mill but now none of them work there. In 1860 the band won the first brass band contest at Crystal Palace in London. (Since the 2nd World War they have won 13 National and 5 European championships.) They have travelled to 9 countries abroad. They have played for Royalty and made 35 long playing records. They have got 26 members and two conductors. Their uniforms are made of Foster's cloth. In 1976 the band were given the (FREEDOM of the CITY of BRADFORD.
